name: C. Tourist Problem
statement:
Iahub is a big fan of tourists. He wants to become a tourist himself, so
he planned a trip. There are destinations on a straight road that Iahub
wants to visit. Iahub starts the excursion from kilometer 0. The
destinations are described by a non-negative integers sequence , , ...,
. The number represents that the th destination is at distance
kilometers from the starting point. No two destinations are located in
the same place. Iahub wants to visit each destination only once. Note
that, crossing through a destination is not considered visiting, unless
Iahub explicitly wants to visit it at that point. Also, after Iahub
visits his last destination, he doesn’t come back to kilometer 0, as he
stops his trip at the last destination. The distance between destination
located at kilometer and next destination, located at kilometer , is
kilometers. We call a "route" an order of visiting the destinations.
Iahub can visit destinations in any order he wants, as long as he visits
all destinations and he doesn’t visit a destination more than once.
Iahub starts writing out on a paper all possible routes and for each of
them, he notes the total distance he would walk. He’s interested in the
average number of kilometers he would walk by choosing a route. As he
got bored of writing out all the routes, he asks you to help him.
